question: The Banking Regulation Act, 1949  gives which of the following the power to license banks, have regulation over shareholding and voting rights of shareholders?
option3: National Bank of Agriculture and Rural Development
explanation: The Banking Regulation Act, 1949  gives the Reserve Bank of India  the power to license banks, have regulation over shareholding and voting rights of shareholders. It gives RBI the power to supervise the appointment of the boards and management.
